Articles.Content:
The goal of this challenge is to travel as far as you can from KSC. (legitimately, of course. Oh, and stay on Kerbin.)

You must use a rover that you have designed, not stock of any mod.

You can use stock, or any (non-prohibited) mods.

RULES!

1. YOU MAY NOT USE HYPEREDIT. PERIOD.

2. You must post pictures of the rover in the VAB, on the runway, in transit, and at the end of your trip.

3. You MUST start from the Runway.

4. No exploits. Do I really have to say this?

5. Don't use MechJeb trickery to auto-pilot.

6. No launching from space and landing back far away.

Prohibited Mods:

KSP Interstellar

Karbonite or Karbonite+ (those engines are fast, man!)

Regulations:

1. Cockpit/Control

1. Can be driven by combination of probe and Kerbal, or just Kerbal.

1.1 Kerbal must be in a EAS-1 External Command Seat.

2. Structure

2. Kerbals must be protected from crashes

LEVELS

Minor Roadtripper

Travel at least 50 km

Roadtripper

Travel at least 100 km

Expert Roadtripper

Travel 300 km

Kernest Shackleton

Travel across Kerbin's north pole.

Continental Tour

Travel from KSC to Kerbin's deserts (don't cross the water!)

MINOR ROADTRIPPER RANK

None atm

ROADTRIPPER RANK

None atm

EXPERT ROADTRIPPER RANK

None atm

CONTINENTAL RANK

None atm

KERNEST SHACKLETON

None atm

Please send me your entries!

Almost was hoping someone had revived the old Dakkar Rally challange.

But I am sure I could do this with a new improved vehicle.

My old one the Amphib-1 drove from KSC, to the Inland "Old" KSC.

Few versions back I drove all the way to the north pole.

Pics from that journey might actually still be on the forum somewhere.

I think this was easily won a few months back...
